intro: Pteromanes, commonly known as the winged fern, is a unique plant belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that resemble wings, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including spore-bearing clusters, are located on the underside of the fronds. Pteromanes plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
